56/** Headers download timeout.
57 * Timeout = base + per_header * (expected number of headers) */
58static constexpr auto HEADERS_DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT_BASE = 15min;
59static constexpr auto HEADERS_DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT_PER_HEADER = 1ms;
60/** How long to wait for a peer to respond to a getheaders request */
61static constexpr auto HEADERS_RESPONSE_TIME{2min};
62/** Protect at least this many outbound peers from disconnection due to slow/
63 * behind headers chain.
64 */
65static constexpr int32_t MAX_OUTBOUND_PEERS_TO_PROTECT_FROM_DISCONNECT = 4;
66/** Timeout for (unprotected) outbound peers to sync to our chainwork */
67static constexpr auto CHAIN_SYNC_TIMEOUT{20min};
68/** How frequently to check for stale tips */
69static constexpr auto STALE_CHECK_INTERVAL{10min};
70/** How frequently to check for extra outbound peers and disconnect */
71static constexpr auto EXTRA_PEER_CHECK_INTERVAL{45s};
72/** Minimum time an outbound-peer-eviction candidate must be connected for, in order to evict */
73static constexpr auto MINIMUM_CONNECT_TIME{30s};
74/** SHA256("main address relay")[0:8] */
75static constexpr uint64_t RANDOMIZER_ID_ADDRESS_RELAY = 0x3cac0035b5866b90ULL;
76/// Age after which a stale block will no longer be served if requested as
77/// protection against fingerprinting. Set to one month, denominated in seconds.
78static constexpr int STALE_RELAY_AGE_LIMIT = 30 * 24 * 60 * 60;
79/// Age after which a block is considered historical for purposes of rate
80/// limiting block relay. Set to one week, denominated in seconds.
81static constexpr int HISTORICAL_BLOCK_AGE = 7 * 24 * 60 * 60;
82/** Time between pings automatically sent out for latency probing and keepalive */
83static constexpr auto PING_INTERVAL{2min};
84/** The maximum number of entries in a locator */
85static const unsigned int MAX_LOCATOR_SZ = 101;
86/** The maximum number of entries in an 'inv' protocol message */
87static const unsigned int MAX_INV_SZ = 50000;
88/** Maximum number of in-flight transaction requests from a peer. It is not a hard limit, but the threshold at which
89 * point the OVERLOADED_PEER_TX_DELAY kicks in. */
90static constexpr int32_t MAX_PEER_TX_REQUEST_IN_FLIGHT = 100;
91/** Maximum number of transactions to consider for requesting, per peer. It provides a reasonable DoS limit to
92 * per-peer memory usage spent on announcements, while covering peers continuously sending INVs at the maximum
93 * rate (by our own policy, see INVENTORY_BROADCAST_PER_SECOND) for several minutes, while not receiving
94 * the actual transaction (from any peer) in response to requests for them. */
95static constexpr int32_t MAX_PEER_TX_ANNOUNCEMENTS = 5000;
96/** How long to delay requesting transactions via txids, if we have wtxid-relaying peers */
97static constexpr auto TXID_RELAY_DELAY{2s};
98/** How long to delay requesting transactions from non-preferred peers */
99static constexpr auto NONPREF_PEER_TX_DELAY{2s};
100/** How long to delay requesting transactions from overloaded peers (see MAX_PEER_TX_REQUEST_IN_FLIGHT). */
101static constexpr auto OVERLOADED_PEER_TX_DELAY{2s};
102/** How long to wait before downloading a transaction from an additional peer */
103static constexpr auto GETDATA_TX_INTERVAL{60s};
104/** Limit to avoid sending big packets. Not used in processing incoming GETDATA for compatibility */
105static const unsigned int MAX_GETDATA_SZ = 1000;
106/** Number of blocks that can be requested at any given time from a single peer. */
107static const int MAX_BLOCKS_IN_TRANSIT_PER_PEER = 16;
108/** Default time during which a peer must stall block download progress before being disconnected.
109 * the actual timeout is increased temporarily if peers are disconnected for hitting the timeout */
110static constexpr auto BLOCK_STALLING_TIMEOUT_DEFAULT{2s};
111/** Maximum timeout for stalling block download. */
112static constexpr auto BLOCK_STALLING_TIMEOUT_MAX{64s};
113/** Number of headers sent in one getheaders result. We rely on the assumption that if a peer sends
114 * less than this number, we reached its tip. Changing this value is a protocol upgrade. */
115static const unsigned int MAX_HEADERS_RESULTS = 2000;
116/** Maximum depth of blocks we're willing to serve as compact blocks to peers
117 * when requested. For older blocks, a regular BLOCK response will be sent. */
118static const int MAX_CMPCTBLOCK_DEPTH = 5;
119/** Maximum depth of blocks we're willing to respond to GETBLOCKTXN requests for. */
120static const int MAX_BLOCKTXN_DEPTH = 10;
121/** Size of the "block download window": how far ahead of our current height do we fetch?
122 * Larger windows tolerate larger download speed differences between peer, but increase the potential
123 * degree of disordering of blocks on disk (which make reindexing and pruning harder). We'll probably
124 * want to make this a per-peer adaptive value at some point. */
125static const unsigned int BLOCK_DOWNLOAD_WINDOW = 1024;
126/** Block download timeout base, expressed in multiples of the block interval (i.e. 10 min) */
127static constexpr double BLOCK_DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT_BASE = 1;
128/** Additional block download timeout per parallel downloading peer (i.e. 5 min) */
129static constexpr double BLOCK_DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT_PER_PEER = 0.5;
130/** Maximum number of headers to announce when relaying blocks with headers message.*/
131static const unsigned int MAX_BLOCKS_TO_ANNOUNCE = 8;
132/** Maximum number of unconnecting headers announcements before DoS score */
133static const int MAX_NUM_UNCONNECTING_HEADERS_MSGS = 10;
134/** Minimum blocks required to signal NODE_NETWORK_LIMITED */
135static const unsigned int NODE_NETWORK_LIMITED_MIN_BLOCKS = 288;
136/** Window, in blocks, for connecting to NODE_NETWORK_LIMITED peers */
137static const unsigned int NODE_NETWORK_LIMITED_ALLOW_CONN_BLOCKS = 144;
138/** Average delay between local address broadcasts */
139static constexpr auto AVG_LOCAL_ADDRESS_BROADCAST_INTERVAL{24h};
140/** Average delay between peer address broadcasts */
141static constexpr auto AVG_ADDRESS_BROADCAST_INTERVAL{30s};
142/** Delay between rotating the peers we relay a particular address to */
143static constexpr auto ROTATE_ADDR_RELAY_DEST_INTERVAL{24h};
144/** Average delay between trickled inventory transmissions for inbound peers.
145 * Blocks and peers with NetPermissionFlags::NoBan permission bypass this. */
146static constexpr auto INBOUND_INVENTORY_BROADCAST_INTERVAL{5s};
147/** Average delay between trickled inventory transmissions for outbound peers.
148 * Use a smaller delay as there is less privacy concern for them.
149 * Blocks and peers with NetPermissionFlags::NoBan permission bypass this. */
150static constexpr auto OUTBOUND_INVENTORY_BROADCAST_INTERVAL{2s};
151/** Maximum rate of inventory items to send per second.
152 * Limits the impact of low-fee transaction floods. */
153static constexpr unsigned int INVENTORY_BROADCAST_PER_SECOND = 7;
154/** Target number of tx inventory items to send per transmission. */
155static constexpr unsigned int INVENTORY_BROADCAST_TARGET = INVENTORY_BROADCAST_PER_SECOND * count_seconds(INBOUND_INVENTORY_BROADCAST_INTERVAL);
156/** Maximum number of inventory items to send per transmission. */
157static constexpr unsigned int INVENTORY_BROADCAST_MAX = 1000;
158static_assert(INVENTORY_BROADCAST_MAX >= INVENTORY_BROADCAST_TARGET, "INVENTORY_BROADCAST_MAX too low");
159static_assert(INVENTORY_BROADCAST_MAX <= MAX_PEER_TX_ANNOUNCEMENTS, "INVENTORY_BROADCAST_MAX too high");
160/** Average delay between feefilter broadcasts in seconds. */
161static constexpr auto AVG_FEEFILTER_BROADCAST_INTERVAL{10min};
162/** Maximum feefilter broadcast delay after significant change. */
163static constexpr auto MAX_FEEFILTER_CHANGE_DELAY{5min};
164/** Maximum number of compact filters that may be requested with one getcfilters. See BIP 157. */
165static constexpr uint32_t MAX_GETCFILTERS_SIZE = 1000;
166/** Maximum number of cf hashes that may be requested with one getcfheaders. See BIP 157. */
167static constexpr uint32_t MAX_GETCFHEADERS_SIZE = 2000;
168/** the maximum percentage of addresses from our addrman to return in response to a getaddr message. */
169static constexpr size_t MAX_PCT_ADDR_TO_SEND = 23;
170/** The maximum number of address records permitted in an ADDR message. */
171static constexpr size_t MAX_ADDR_TO_SEND{1000};
172/** The maximum rate of address records we're willing to process on average. Can be bypassed using
173 * the NetPermissionFlags::Addr permission. */
174static constexpr double MAX_ADDR_RATE_PER_SECOND{0.1};
175/** The soft limit of the address processing token bucket (the regular MAX_ADDR_RATE_PER_SECOND
176 * based increments won't go above this, but the MAX_ADDR_TO_SEND increment following GETADDR
177 * is exempt from this limit). */
178static constexpr size_t MAX_ADDR_PROCESSING_TOKEN_BUCKET{MAX_ADDR_TO_SEND};
179/** The compactblocks version we support. See BIP 152. */
180static constexpr uint64_t CMPCTBLOCKS_VERSION{2};
181
182// Internal stuff
183namespace {
184/** Blocks that are in flight, and that are in the queue to be downloaded. */
185struct QueuedBlock {
186 /** BlockIndex. We must have this since we only request blocks when we've already validated the header. */
187 const CBlockIndex* pindex;
188 /** Optional, used for CMPCTBLOCK downloads */
189 std::unique_ptr<PartiallyDownloadedBlock> partialBlock;
190};
191
192/**
193 * Data structure for an individual peer. This struct is not protected by
194 * cs_main since it does not contain validation-critical data.
195 *
196 * Memory is owned by shared pointers and this object is destructed when
197 * the refcount drops to zero.
198 *
199 * Mutexes inside this struct must not be held when locking m_peer_mutex.
200 *
201 * TODO: move most members from CNodeState to this structure.
202 * TODO: move remaining application-layer data members from CNode to this structure.
203 */
204struct Peer {
205 /** Same id as the CNode object for this peer */
206 const NodeId m_id{0};
207
208 /** Services we offered to this peer.
209 *
210 * This is supplied by CConnman during peer initialization. It's const
211 * because there is no protocol defined for renegotiating services
212 * initially offered to a peer. The set of local services we offer should
213 * not change after initialization.
214 *
215 * An interesting example of this is NODE_NETWORK and initial block
216 * download: a node which starts up from scratch doesn't have any blocks
217 * to serve, but still advertises NODE_NETWORK because it will eventually
218 * fulfill this role after IBD completes. P2P code is written in such a
219 * way that it can gracefully handle peers who don't make good on their
220 * service advertisements. */
221 const ServiceFlags m_our_services;
222 /** Services this peer offered to us. */
223 std::atomic<ServiceFlags> m_their_services{NODE_NONE};
224
225 /** Protects misbehavior data members */
226 Mutex m_misbehavior_mutex;
227 /** Accumulated misbehavior score for this peer */
228 int m_misbehavior_score GUARDED_BY(m_misbehavior_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_misbehavior_mutex))){0};
229 /** Whether this peer should be disconnected and marked as discouraged (unless it has NetPermissionFlags::NoBan permission). */
230 bool m_should_discourage GUARDED_BY(m_misbehavior_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_misbehavior_mutex))){false};
231
232 /** Protects block inventory data members */
233 Mutex m_block_inv_mutex;
234 /** List of blocks that we'll announce via an `inv` message.
235 * There is no final sorting before sending, as they are always sent
236 * immediately and in the order requested. */
237 std::vector<uint256> m_blocks_for_inv_relay GUARDED_BY(m_block_inv_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_block_inv_mutex)));
238 /** Unfiltered list of blocks that we'd like to announce via a `headers`
239 * message. If we can't announce via a `headers` message, we'll fall back to
240 * announcing via `inv`. */
241 std::vector<uint256> m_blocks_for_headers_relay GUARDED_BY(m_block_inv_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_block_inv_mutex)));
242 /** The final block hash that we sent in an `inv` message to this peer.
243 * When the peer requests this block, we send an `inv` message to trigger
244 * the peer to request the next sequence of block hashes.
245 * Most peers use headers-first syncing, which doesn't use this mechanism */
246 uint256 m_continuation_block GUARDED_BY(m_block_inv_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_block_inv_mutex))) {};
247
248 /** This peer's reported block height when we connected */
249 std::atomic<int> m_starting_height{-1};
250
251 /** The pong reply we're expecting, or 0 if no pong expected. */
252 std::atomic<uint64_t> m_ping_nonce_sent{0};
253 /** When the last ping was sent, or 0 if no ping was ever sent */
254 std::atomic<std::chrono::microseconds> m_ping_start{0us};
255 /** Whether a ping has been requested by the user */
256 std::atomic<bool> m_ping_queued{false};
257
258 /** Whether this peer relays txs via wtxid */
259 std::atomic<bool> m_wtxid_relay{false};
260 /** The feerate in the most recent BIP133 `feefilter` message sent to the peer.
261 * It is *not* a p2p protocol violation for the peer to send us
262 * transactions with a lower fee rate than this. See BIP133. */
263 CAmount m_fee_filter_sent GUARDED_BY(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex
))){0};
264 /** Timestamp after which we will send the next BIP133 `feefilter` message
265 * to the peer. */
266 std::chrono::microseconds m_next_send_feefilter GUARDED_BY(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex
))){0};
267
268 struct TxRelay {
269 mutable RecursiveMutex m_bloom_filter_mutex;
270 /** Whether we relay transactions to this peer. */
271 bool m_relay_txs GUARDED_BY(m_bloom_filter_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_bloom_filter_mutex))){false};
272 /** A bloom filter for which transactions to announce to the peer. See BIP37. */
273 std::unique_ptr<CBloomFilter> m_bloom_filter PT_GUARDED_BY(m_bloom_filter_mutex)__attribute__((pt_guarded_by(m_bloom_filter_mutex))) GUARDED_BY(m_bloom_filter_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_bloom_filter_mutex))){nullptr};
274
275 mutable RecursiveMutex m_tx_inventory_mutex;
276 /** A filter of all the (w)txids that the peer has announced to
277 * us or we have announced to the peer. We use this to avoid announcing
278 * the same (w)txid to a peer that already has the transaction. */
279 CRollingBloomFilter m_tx_inventory_known_filter GUARDED_BY(m_tx_inventory_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_tx_inventory_mutex))){50000, 0.000001};
280 /** Set of transaction ids we still have to announce (txid for
281 * non-wtxid-relay peers, wtxid for wtxid-relay peers). We use the
282 * mempool to sort transactions in dependency order before relay, so
283 * this does not have to be sorted. */
284 std::set<uint256> m_tx_inventory_to_send GUARDED_BY(m_tx_inventory_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_tx_inventory_mutex)));
285 /** Whether the peer has requested us to send our complete mempool. Only
286 * permitted if the peer has NetPermissionFlags::Mempool or we advertise
287 * NODE_BLOOM. See BIP35. */
288 bool m_send_mempool GUARDED_BY(m_tx_inventory_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_tx_inventory_mutex))){false};
289 /** The next time after which we will send an `inv` message containing
290 * transaction announcements to this peer. */
291 std::chrono::microseconds m_next_inv_send_time GUARDED_BY(m_tx_inventory_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_tx_inventory_mutex))){0};
292 /** The mempool sequence num at which we sent the last `inv` message to this peer.
293 * Can relay txs with lower sequence numbers than this (see CTxMempool::info_for_relay). */
294 uint64_t m_last_inv_sequence GUARDED_BY(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex
))){1};
295
296 /** Minimum fee rate with which to filter transaction announcements to this node. See BIP133. */
297 std::atomic<CAmount> m_fee_filter_received{0};
298 };
299
300 /* Initializes a TxRelay struct for this peer. Can be called at most once for a peer. */
301 TxRelay* SetTxRelay() EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_tx_relay_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_tx_relay_mutex)))
302 {
303 LOCK(m_tx_relay_mutex)UniqueLock criticalblock324(MaybeCheckNotHeld(m_tx_relay_mutex
), "m_tx_relay_mutex", "net_processing.cpp", 303);
304 Assume(!m_tx_relay)inline_assertion_check<false>(!m_tx_relay, "net_processing.cpp"
, 304, __func__, "!m_tx_relay");
305 m_tx_relay = std::make_unique<Peer::TxRelay>();
306 return m_tx_relay.get();
307 };
308
309 TxRelay* GetTxRelay() EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_tx_relay_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_tx_relay_mutex)))
310 {
311 return WITH_LOCK(m_tx_relay_mutex, return m_tx_relay.get())(MaybeCheckNotHeld(m_tx_relay_mutex), [&]() -> decltype
(auto) { UniqueLock criticalblock325(MaybeCheckNotHeld(m_tx_relay_mutex
), "m_tx_relay_mutex", "net_processing.cpp", 311); return m_tx_relay
.get(); }());
312 };
313
314 /** A vector of addresses to send to the peer, limited to MAX_ADDR_TO_SEND. */
315 std::vector<CAddress> m_addrs_to_send GUARDED_BY(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex
)));
316 /** Probabilistic filter to track recent addr messages relayed with this
317 * peer. Used to avoid relaying redundant addresses to this peer.
318 *
319 * We initialize this filter for outbound peers (other than
320 * block-relay-only connections) or when an inbound peer sends us an
321 * address related message (ADDR, ADDRV2, GETADDR).
322 *
323 * Presence of this filter must correlate with m_addr_relay_enabled.
324 **/
325 std::unique_ptr<CRollingBloomFilter> m_addr_known GUARDED_BY(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex
)));
326 /** Whether we are participating in address relay with this connection.
327 *
328 * We set this bool to true for outbound peers (other than
329 * block-relay-only connections), or when an inbound peer sends us an
330 * address related message (ADDR, ADDRV2, GETADDR).
331 *
332 * We use this bool to decide whether a peer is eligible for gossiping
333 * addr messages. This avoids relaying to peers that are unlikely to
334 * forward them, effectively blackholing self announcements. Reasons
335 * peers might support addr relay on the link include that they connected
336 * to us as a block-relay-only peer or they are a light client.
337 *
338 * This field must correlate with whether m_addr_known has been
339 * initialized.*/
340 std::atomic_bool m_addr_relay_enabled{false};
341 /** Whether a getaddr request to this peer is outstanding. */
342 bool m_getaddr_sent GUARDED_BY(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex
))){false};
343 /** Guards address sending timers. */
344 mutable Mutex m_addr_send_times_mutex;
345 /** Time point to send the next ADDR message to this peer. */
346 std::chrono::microseconds m_next_addr_send GUARDED_BY(m_addr_send_times_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_addr_send_times_mutex))){0};
347 /** Time point to possibly re-announce our local address to this peer. */
348 std::chrono::microseconds m_next_local_addr_send GUARDED_BY(m_addr_send_times_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_addr_send_times_mutex))){0};
349 /** Whether the peer has signaled support for receiving ADDRv2 (BIP155)
350 * messages, indicating a preference to receive ADDRv2 instead of ADDR ones. */
351 std::atomic_bool m_wants_addrv2{false};
352 /** Whether this peer has already sent us a getaddr message. */
353 bool m_getaddr_recvd GUARDED_BY(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex
))){false};
354 /** Number of addresses that can be processed from this peer. Start at 1 to
355 * permit self-announcement. */
356 double m_addr_token_bucket GUARDED_BY(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex
))){1.0};
357 /** When m_addr_token_bucket was last updated */
358 std::chrono::microseconds m_addr_token_timestamp GUARDED_BY(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex
))){GetTime<std::chrono::microseconds>()};
359 /** Total number of addresses that were dropped due to rate limiting. */
360 std::atomic<uint64_t> m_addr_rate_limited{0};
361 /** Total number of addresses that were processed (excludes rate-limited ones). */
362 std::atomic<uint64_t> m_addr_processed{0};
363
364 /** Whether we've sent this peer a getheaders in response to an inv prior to initial-headers-sync completing */
365 bool m_inv_triggered_getheaders_before_sync GUARDED_BY(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex
))){false};
366
367 /** Protects m_getdata_requests **/
368 Mutex m_getdata_requests_mutex;
369 /** Work queue of items requested by this peer **/
370 std::deque<CInv> m_getdata_requests GUARDED_BY(m_getdata_requests_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_getdata_requests_mutex)));
371
372 /** Time of the last getheaders message to this peer */
373 NodeClock::time_point m_last_getheaders_timestamp GUARDED_BY(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex
))){};
374
375 /** Protects m_headers_sync **/
376 Mutex m_headers_sync_mutex;
377 /** Headers-sync state for this peer (eg for initial sync, or syncing large
378 * reorgs) **/
379 std::unique_ptr<HeadersSyncState> m_headers_sync PT_GUARDED_BY(m_headers_sync_mutex)__attribute__((pt_guarded_by(m_headers_sync_mutex))) GUARDED_BY(m_headers_sync_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_headers_sync_mutex))) {};
380
381 /** Whether we've sent our peer a sendheaders message. **/
382 std::atomic<bool> m_sent_sendheaders{false};
383
384 /** Length of current-streak of unconnecting headers announcements */
385 int m_num_unconnecting_headers_msgs GUARDED_BY(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex
))){0};
386
387 /** When to potentially disconnect peer for stalling headers download */
388 std::chrono::microseconds m_headers_sync_timeout GUARDED_BY(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex
))){0us};
389
390 /** Whether this peer wants invs or headers (when possible) for block announcements */
391 bool m_prefers_headers GUARDED_BY(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex
))){false};
392
393 explicit Peer(NodeId id, ServiceFlags our_services)
394 : m_id{id}
395 , m_our_services{our_services}
396 {}
397
398private:
399 mutable Mutex m_tx_relay_mutex;
400
401 /** Transaction relay data. May be a nullptr. */
402 std::unique_ptr<TxRelay> m_tx_relay GUARDED_BY(m_tx_relay_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_tx_relay_mutex)));
403};
404
405using PeerRef = std::shared_ptr<Peer>;
406
407/**
408 * Maintain validation-specific state about nodes, protected by cs_main, instead
409 * by CNode's own locks. This simplifies asynchronous operation, where
410 * processing of incoming data is done after the ProcessMessage call returns,
411 * and we're no longer holding the node's locks.
412 */
413struct CNodeState {
414 //! The best known block we know this peer has announced.
415 const CBlockIndex* pindexBestKnownBlock{nullptr};
416 //! The hash of the last unknown block this peer has announced.
417 uint256 hashLastUnknownBlock{};
418 //! The last full block we both have.
419 const CBlockIndex* pindexLastCommonBlock{nullptr};
420 //! The best header we have sent our peer.
421 const CBlockIndex* pindexBestHeaderSent{nullptr};
422 //! Whether we've started headers synchronization with this peer.
423 bool fSyncStarted{false};
424 //! Since when we're stalling block download progress (in microseconds), or 0.
425 std::chrono::microseconds m_stalling_since{0us};
426 std::list<QueuedBlock> vBlocksInFlight;
427 //! When the first entry in vBlocksInFlight started downloading. Don't care when vBlocksInFlight is empty.
428 std::chrono::microseconds m_downloading_since{0us};
429 //! Whether we consider this a preferred download peer.
430 bool fPreferredDownload{false};
431 /** Whether this peer wants invs or cmpctblocks (when possible) for block announcements. */
432 bool m_requested_hb_cmpctblocks{false};
433 /** Whether this peer will send us cmpctblocks if we request them. */
434 bool m_provides_cmpctblocks{false};
435
436 /** State used to enforce CHAIN_SYNC_TIMEOUT and EXTRA_PEER_CHECK_INTERVAL logic.
437 *
438 * Both are only in effect for outbound, non-manual, non-protected connections.
439 * Any peer protected (m_protect = true) is not chosen for eviction. A peer is
440 * marked as protected if all of these are true:
441 * - its connection type is IsBlockOnlyConn() == false
442 * - it gave us a valid connecting header
443 * - we haven't reached MAX_OUTBOUND_PEERS_TO_PROTECT_FROM_DISCONNECT yet
444 * - its chain tip has at least as much work as ours
445 *
446 * CHAIN_SYNC_TIMEOUT: if a peer's best known block has less work than our tip,
447 * set a timeout CHAIN_SYNC_TIMEOUT in the future:
448 * - If at timeout their best known block now has more work than our tip
449 * when the timeout was set, then either reset the timeout or clear it
450 * (after comparing against our current tip's work)
451 * - If at timeout their best known block still has less work than our
452 * tip did when the timeout was set, then send a getheaders message,
453 * and set a shorter timeout, HEADERS_RESPONSE_TIME seconds in future.
454 * If their best known block is still behind when that new timeout is
455 * reached, disconnect.
456 *
457 * EXTRA_PEER_CHECK_INTERVAL: after each interval, if we have too many outbound peers,
458 * drop the outbound one that least recently announced us a new block.
459 */
460 struct ChainSyncTimeoutState {
461 //! A timeout used for checking whether our peer has sufficiently synced
462 std::chrono::seconds m_timeout{0s};
463 //! A header with the work we require on our peer's chain
464 const CBlockIndex* m_work_header{nullptr};
465 //! After timeout is reached, set to true after sending getheaders
466 bool m_sent_getheaders{false};
467 //! Whether this peer is protected from disconnection due to a bad/slow chain
468 bool m_protect{false};
469 };
470
471 ChainSyncTimeoutState m_chain_sync;
472
473 //! Time of last new block announcement
474 int64_t m_last_block_announcement{0};
475
476 //! Whether this peer is an inbound connection
477 const bool m_is_inbound;
478
479 CNodeState(bool is_inbound) : m_is_inbound(is_inbound) {}
480};
481
482class PeerManagerImpl final : public PeerManager
483{
484public:
485 PeerManagerImpl(CConnman& connman, AddrMan& addrman,
486 BanMan* banman, ChainstateManager& chainman,
487 CTxMemPool& pool, Options opts);
488
489 /** Overridden from CValidationInterface. */
490 void BlockConnected(ChainstateRole role, const std::shared_ptr<const CBlock>& pblock, const CBlockIndex* pindexConnected) override
491 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_recent_confirmed_transactions_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_recent_confirmed_transactions_mutex
)));
492 void BlockDisconnected(const std::shared_ptr<const CBlock> &block, const CBlockIndex* pindex) override
493 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_recent_confirmed_transactions_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_recent_confirmed_transactions_mutex
)));
494 void UpdatedBlockTip(const CBlockIndex *pindexNew, const CBlockIndex *pindexFork, bool fInitialDownload) override
495 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_peer_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_peer_mutex)));
496 void BlockChecked(const CBlock& block, const BlockValidationState& state) override
497 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_peer_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_peer_mutex)));
498 void NewPoWValidBlock(const CBlockIndex *pindex, const std::shared_ptr<const CBlock>& pblock) override
499 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_most_recent_block_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_most_recent_block_mutex
)));
500
501 /** Implement NetEventsInterface */
502 void InitializeNode(CNode& node, ServiceFlags our_services) override EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_peer_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_peer_mutex)));
503 void FinalizeNode(const CNode& node) override EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_peer_mutex, !m_headers_presync_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_peer_mutex, !m_headers_presync_mutex
)));
504 bool HasAllDesirableServiceFlags(ServiceFlags services) const override;
505 bool ProcessMessages(CNode* pfrom, std::atomic<bool>& interrupt) override
506 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_peer_mutex, !m_recent_confirmed_transactions_mutex, !m_most_recent_block_mutex, !m_headers_presync_mutex, g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_peer_mutex, !m_recent_confirmed_transactions_mutex
, !m_most_recent_block_mutex, !m_headers_presync_mutex, g_msgproc_mutex
)));
507 bool SendMessages(CNode* pto) override
508 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_peer_mutex, !m_recent_confirmed_transactions_mutex, !m_most_recent_block_mutex, g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_peer_mutex, !m_recent_confirmed_transactions_mutex
, !m_most_recent_block_mutex, g_msgproc_mutex)));
509
510 /** Implement PeerManager */
511 void StartScheduledTasks(CScheduler& scheduler) override;
512 void CheckForStaleTipAndEvictPeers() override;
513 std::optional<std::string> FetchBlock(NodeId peer_id, const CBlockIndex& block_index) override
514 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_peer_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_peer_mutex)));
515 bool GetNodeStateStats(NodeId nodeid, CNodeStateStats& stats) const override EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_peer_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_peer_mutex)));
516 bool IgnoresIncomingTxs() override { return m_opts.ignore_incoming_txs; }
517 void SendPings() override EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_peer_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_peer_mutex)));
518 void RelayTransaction(const uint256& txid, const uint256& wtxid) override EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_peer_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_peer_mutex)));
519 void SetBestBlock(int height, std::chrono::seconds time) override
520 {
521 m_best_height = height;
522 m_best_block_time = time;
523 };
524 void UnitTestMisbehaving(NodeId peer_id, int howmuch) override EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_peer_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_peer_mutex))) { Misbehaving(*Assert(GetPeerRef(peer_id))inline_assertion_check<true>(GetPeerRef(peer_id), "net_processing.cpp"
, 524, __func__, "GetPeerRef(peer_id)"), howmuch, ""); };
525 void ProcessMessage(CNode& pfrom, const std::string& msg_type, DataStream& vRecv,
526 const std::chrono::microseconds time_received, const std::atomic<bool>& interruptMsgProc) override
527 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_peer_mutex, !m_recent_confirmed_transactions_mutex, !m_most_recent_block_mutex, !m_headers_presync_mutex, g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_peer_mutex, !m_recent_confirmed_transactions_mutex
, !m_most_recent_block_mutex, !m_headers_presync_mutex, g_msgproc_mutex
)));
528 void UpdateLastBlockAnnounceTime(NodeId node, int64_t time_in_seconds) override;
529 ServiceFlags GetDesirableServiceFlags(ServiceFlags services) const override;
530
531private:
532 /** Consider evicting an outbound peer based on the amount of time they've been behind our tip */
533 void ConsiderEviction(CNode& pto, Peer& peer, std::chrono::seconds time_in_seconds) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main, g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main, g_msgproc_mutex
)));
534
535 /** If we have extra outbound peers, try to disconnect the one with the oldest block announcement */
536 void EvictExtraOutboundPeers(std::chrono::seconds now) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main)));
537
538 /** Retrieve unbroadcast transactions from the mempool and reattempt sending to peers */
539 void ReattemptInitialBroadcast(CScheduler& scheduler) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_peer_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_peer_mutex)));
540
541 /** Get a shared pointer to the Peer object.
542 * May return an empty shared_ptr if the Peer object can't be found. */
543 PeerRef GetPeerRef(NodeId id) const EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_peer_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_peer_mutex)));
544
545 /** Get a shared pointer to the Peer object and remove it from m_peer_map.
546 * May return an empty shared_ptr if the Peer object can't be found. */
547 PeerRef RemovePeer(NodeId id) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_peer_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_peer_mutex)));
548
549 /**
550 * Increment peer's misbehavior score. If the new value >= DISCOURAGEMENT_THRESHOLD, mark the node
551 * to be discouraged, meaning the peer might be disconnected and added to the discouragement filter.
552 */
553 void Misbehaving(Peer& peer, int howmuch, const std::string& message);
554
555 /**
556 * Potentially mark a node discouraged based on the contents of a BlockValidationState object
557 *
558 * @param[in] via_compact_block this bool is passed in because net_processing should
559 * punish peers differently depending on whether the data was provided in a compact
560 * block message or not. If the compact block had a valid header, but contained invalid
561 * txs, the peer should not be punished. See BIP 152.
562 *
563 * @return Returns true if the peer was punished (probably disconnected)
564 */
565 bool MaybePunishNodeForBlock(NodeId nodeid, const BlockValidationState& state,
566 bool via_compact_block, const std::string& message = "")
567 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_peer_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_peer_mutex)));
568
569 /**
570 * Potentially disconnect and discourage a node based on the contents of a TxValidationState object
571 *
572 * @return Returns true if the peer was punished (probably disconnected)
573 */
574 bool MaybePunishNodeForTx(NodeId nodeid, const TxValidationState& state)
575 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_peer_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_peer_mutex)));
576
577 /** Maybe disconnect a peer and discourage future connections from its address.
578 *
579 * @param[in] pnode The node to check.
580 * @param[in] peer The peer object to check.
581 * @return True if the peer was marked for disconnection in this function
582 */
583 bool MaybeDiscourageAndDisconnect(CNode& pnode, Peer& peer);
584
585 /**
586 * Reconsider orphan transactions after a parent has been accepted to the mempool.
587 *
588 * @peer[in] peer The peer whose orphan transactions we will reconsider. Generally only
589 * one orphan will be reconsidered on each call of this function. If an
590 * accepted orphan has orphaned children, those will need to be
591 * reconsidered, creating more work, possibly for other peers.
592 * @return True if meaningful work was done (an orphan was accepted/rejected).
593 * If no meaningful work was done, then the work set for this peer
594 * will be empty.
595 */
596 bool ProcessOrphanTx(Peer& peer)
597 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_peer_mutex, g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_peer_mutex, g_msgproc_mutex
)));
598
599 /** Process a single headers message from a peer.
600 *
601 * @param[in] pfrom CNode of the peer
602 * @param[in] peer The peer sending us the headers
603 * @param[in] headers The headers received. Note that this may be modified within ProcessHeadersMessage.
604 * @param[in] via_compact_block Whether this header came in via compact block handling.
605 */
606 void ProcessHeadersMessage(CNode& pfrom, Peer& peer,
607 std::vector<CBlockHeader>&& headers,
608 bool via_compact_block)
609 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_peer_mutex, !m_headers_presync_mutex, g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_peer_mutex, !m_headers_presync_mutex
, g_msgproc_mutex)));
610 /** Various helpers for headers processing, invoked by ProcessHeadersMessage() */
611 /** Return true if headers are continuous and have valid proof-of-work (DoS points assigned on failure) */
612 bool CheckHeadersPoW(const std::vector<CBlockHeader>& headers, const Consensus::Params& consensusParams, Peer& peer);
613 /** Calculate an anti-DoS work threshold for headers chains */
614 arith_uint256 GetAntiDoSWorkThreshold();
615 /** Deal with state tracking and headers sync for peers that send the
616 * occasional non-connecting header (this can happen due to BIP 130 headers
617 * announcements for blocks interacting with the 2hr (MAX_FUTURE_BLOCK_TIME) rule). */
618 void HandleFewUnconnectingHeaders(CNode& pfrom, Peer& peer, const std::vector<CBlockHeader>& headers) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(g_msgproc_mutex)));
619 /** Return true if the headers connect to each other, false otherwise */
620 bool CheckHeadersAreContinuous(const std::vector<CBlockHeader>& headers) const;
621 /** Try to continue a low-work headers sync that has already begun.
622 * Assumes the caller has already verified the headers connect, and has
623 * checked that each header satisfies the proof-of-work target included in
624 * the header.
625 * @param[in] peer The peer we're syncing with.
626 * @param[in] pfrom CNode of the peer
627 * @param[in,out] headers The headers to be processed.
628 * @return True if the passed in headers were successfully processed
629 * as the continuation of a low-work headers sync in progress;
630 * false otherwise.
631 * If false, the passed in headers will be returned back to
632 * the caller.
633 * If true, the returned headers may be empty, indicating
634 * there is no more work for the caller to do; or the headers
635 * may be populated with entries that have passed anti-DoS
636 * checks (and therefore may be validated for block index
637 * acceptance by the caller).
638 */
639 bool IsContinuationOfLowWorkHeadersSync(Peer& peer, CNode& pfrom,
640 std::vector<CBlockHeader>& headers)
641 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(peer.m_headers_sync_mutex, !m_headers_presync_mutex, g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(peer.m_headers_sync_mutex
, !m_headers_presync_mutex, g_msgproc_mutex)));
642 /** Check work on a headers chain to be processed, and if insufficient,
643 * initiate our anti-DoS headers sync mechanism.
644 *
645 * @param[in] peer The peer whose headers we're processing.
646 * @param[in] pfrom CNode of the peer
647 * @param[in] chain_start_header Where these headers connect in our index.
648 * @param[in,out] headers The headers to be processed.
649 *
650 * @return True if chain was low work (headers will be empty after
651 * calling); false otherwise.
652 */
653 bool TryLowWorkHeadersSync(Peer& peer, CNode& pfrom,
654 const CBlockIndex* chain_start_header,
655 std::vector<CBlockHeader>& headers)
656 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!peer.m_headers_sync_mutex, !m_peer_mutex, !m_headers_presync_mutex, g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!peer.m_headers_sync_mutex
, !m_peer_mutex, !m_headers_presync_mutex, g_msgproc_mutex)));
657
658 /** Return true if the given header is an ancestor of
659 * m_chainman.m_best_header or our current tip */
660 bool IsAncestorOfBestHeaderOrTip(const CBlockIndex* header) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main)));
661
662 /** Request further headers from this peer with a given locator.
663 * We don't issue a getheaders message if we have a recent one outstanding.
664 * This returns true if a getheaders is actually sent, and false otherwise.
665 */
666 bool MaybeSendGetHeaders(CNode& pfrom, const CBlockLocator& locator, Peer& peer) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(g_msgproc_mutex)));
667 /** Potentially fetch blocks from this peer upon receipt of a new headers tip */
668 void HeadersDirectFetchBlocks(CNode& pfrom, const Peer& peer, const CBlockIndex& last_header);
669 /** Update peer state based on received headers message */
670 void UpdatePeerStateForReceivedHeaders(CNode& pfrom, Peer& peer, const CBlockIndex& last_header, bool received_new_header, bool may_have_more_headers)
671 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(g_msgproc_mutex)));
672
673 void SendBlockTransactions(CNode& pfrom, Peer& peer, const CBlock& block, const BlockTransactionsRequest& req);
674
675 /** Register with TxRequestTracker that an INV has been received from a
676 * peer. The announcement parameters are decided in PeerManager and then
677 * passed to TxRequestTracker. */
678 void AddTxAnnouncement(const CNode& node, const GenTxid& gtxid, std::chrono::microseconds current_time)
679 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(::cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(::cs_main)));
680
681 /** Send a message to a peer */
682 void PushMessage(CNode& node, CSerializedNetMsg&& msg) const { m_connman.PushMessage(&node, std::move(msg)); }
683 template <typename... Args>
684 void MakeAndPushMessage(CNode& node, std::string msg_type, Args&&... args) const
685 {
686 m_connman.PushMessage(&node, NetMsg::Make(std::move(msg_type), std::forward<Args>(args)...));
687 }
688
689 /** Send a version message to a peer */
690 void PushNodeVersion(CNode& pnode, const Peer& peer);
691
692 /** Send a ping message every PING_INTERVAL or if requested via RPC. May
693 * mark the peer to be disconnected if a ping has timed out.
694 * We use mockable time for ping timeouts, so setmocktime may cause pings
695 * to time out. */
696 void MaybeSendPing(CNode& node_to, Peer& peer, std::chrono::microseconds now);
697
698 /** Send `addr` messages on a regular schedule. */
699 void MaybeSendAddr(CNode& node, Peer& peer, std::chrono::microseconds current_time) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(g_msgproc_mutex)));
700
701 /** Send a single `sendheaders` message, after we have completed headers sync with a peer. */
702 void MaybeSendSendHeaders(CNode& node, Peer& peer) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(g_msgproc_mutex)));
703
704 /** Relay (gossip) an address to a few randomly chosen nodes.
705 *
706 * @param[in] originator The id of the peer that sent us the address. We don't want to relay it back.
707 * @param[in] addr Address to relay.
708 * @param[in] fReachable Whether the address' network is reachable. We relay unreachable
709 * addresses less.
710 */
711 void RelayAddress(NodeId originator, const CAddress& addr, bool fReachable) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_peer_mutex, g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_peer_mutex, g_msgproc_mutex
)));
712
713 /** Send `feefilter` message. */
714 void MaybeSendFeefilter(CNode& node, Peer& peer, std::chrono::microseconds current_time) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(g_msgproc_mutex)));
715
716 FastRandomContext m_rng GUARDED_BY(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex
)));
717
718 FeeFilterRounder m_fee_filter_rounder GUARDED_BY(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex
)));
719
720 const CChainParams& m_chainparams;
721 CConnman& m_connman;
722 AddrMan& m_addrman;
723 /** Pointer to this node's banman. May be nullptr - check existence before dereferencing. */
724 BanMan* const m_banman;
725 ChainstateManager& m_chainman;
726 CTxMemPool& m_mempool;
727 TxRequestTracker m_txrequest GUARDED_BY(::cs_main)__attribute__((guarded_by(::cs_main)));
728 std::unique_ptr<TxReconciliationTracker> m_txreconciliation;
729
730 /** The height of the best chain */
731 std::atomic<int> m_best_height{-1};
732 /** The time of the best chain tip block */
733 std::atomic<std::chrono::seconds> m_best_block_time{0s};
734
735 /** Next time to check for stale tip */
736 std::chrono::seconds m_stale_tip_check_time GUARDED_BY(cs_main)__attribute__((guarded_by(cs_main))){0s};
737
738 const Options m_opts;
739
740 bool RejectIncomingTxs(const CNode& peer) const;
741
742 /** Whether we've completed initial sync yet, for determining when to turn
743 * on extra block-relay-only peers. */
744 bool m_initial_sync_finished GUARDED_BY(cs_main)__attribute__((guarded_by(cs_main))){false};
745
746 /** Protects m_peer_map. This mutex must not be locked while holding a lock
747 * on any of the mutexes inside a Peer object. */
748 mutable Mutex m_peer_mutex;
749 /**
750 * Map of all Peer objects, keyed by peer id. This map is protected
751 * by the m_peer_mutex. Once a shared pointer reference is
752 * taken, the lock may be released. Individual fields are protected by
753 * their own locks.
754 */
755 std::map<NodeId, PeerRef> m_peer_map GUARDED_BY(m_peer_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_peer_mutex)));
756
757 /** Map maintaining per-node state. */
758 std::map<NodeId, CNodeState> m_node_states GUARDED_BY(cs_main)__attribute__((guarded_by(cs_main)));
759
760 /** Get a pointer to a const CNodeState, used when not mutating the CNodeState object. */
761 const CNodeState* State(NodeId pnode) const EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main)));
762 /** Get a pointer to a mutable CNodeState. */
763 CNodeState* State(NodeId pnode) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main)));
764
765 uint32_t GetFetchFlags(const Peer& peer) const;
766
767 std::atomic<std::chrono::microseconds> m_next_inv_to_inbounds{0us};
768
769 /** Number of nodes with fSyncStarted. */
770 int nSyncStarted GUARDED_BY(cs_main)__attribute__((guarded_by(cs_main))) = 0;
771
772 /** Hash of the last block we received via INV */
773 uint256 m_last_block_inv_triggering_headers_sync GUARDED_BY(g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(g_msgproc_mutex))){};
774
775 /**
776 * Sources of received blocks, saved to be able punish them when processing
777 * happens afterwards.
778 * Set mapBlockSource[hash].second to false if the node should not be
779 * punished if the block is invalid.
780 */
781 std::map<uint256, std::pair<NodeId, bool>> mapBlockSource GUARDED_BY(cs_main)__attribute__((guarded_by(cs_main)));
782
783 /** Number of peers with wtxid relay. */
784 std::atomic<int> m_wtxid_relay_peers{0};
785
786 /** Number of outbound peers with m_chain_sync.m_protect. */
787 int m_outbound_peers_with_protect_from_disconnect GUARDED_BY(cs_main)__attribute__((guarded_by(cs_main))) = 0;
788
789 /** Number of preferable block download peers. */
790 int m_num_preferred_download_peers GUARDED_BY(cs_main)__attribute__((guarded_by(cs_main))){0};
791
792 /** Stalling timeout for blocks in IBD */
793 std::atomic<std::chrono::seconds> m_block_stalling_timeout{BLOCK_STALLING_TIMEOUT_DEFAULT};
794
795 bool AlreadyHaveTx(const GenTxid& gtxid)
796 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main, !m_recent_confirmed_transactions_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main, !m_recent_confirmed_transactions_mutex
)));
797
798 /**
799 * Filter for transactions that were recently rejected by the mempool.
800 * These are not rerequested until the chain tip changes, at which point
801 * the entire filter is reset.
802 *
803 * Without this filter we'd be re-requesting txs from each of our peers,
804 * increasing bandwidth consumption considerably. For instance, with 100
805 * peers, half of which relay a tx we don't accept, that might be a 50x
806 * bandwidth increase. A flooding attacker attempting to roll-over the
807 * filter using minimum-sized, 60byte, transactions might manage to send
808 * 1000/sec if we have fast peers, so we pick 120,000 to give our peers a
809 * two minute window to send invs to us.
810 *
811 * Decreasing the false positive rate is fairly cheap, so we pick one in a
812 * million to make it highly unlikely for users to have issues with this
813 * filter.
814 *
815 * We typically only add wtxids to this filter. For non-segwit
816 * transactions, the txid == wtxid, so this only prevents us from
817 * re-downloading non-segwit transactions when communicating with
818 * non-wtxidrelay peers -- which is important for avoiding malleation
819 * attacks that could otherwise interfere with transaction relay from
820 * non-wtxidrelay peers. For communicating with wtxidrelay peers, having
821 * the reject filter store wtxids is exactly what we want to avoid
822 * redownload of a rejected transaction.
823 *
824 * In cases where we can tell that a segwit transaction will fail
825 * validation no matter the witness, we may add the txid of such
826 * transaction to the filter as well. This can be helpful when
827 * communicating with txid-relay peers or if we were to otherwise fetch a
828 * transaction via txid (eg in our orphan handling).
829 *
830 * Memory used: 1.3 MB
831 */
832 CRollingBloomFilter m_recent_rejects GUARDED_BY(::cs_main)__attribute__((guarded_by(::cs_main))){120'000, 0.000'001};
833 uint256 hashRecentRejectsChainTip GUARDED_BY(cs_main)__attribute__((guarded_by(cs_main)));
834
835 /*
836 * Filter for transactions that have been recently confirmed.
837 * We use this to avoid requesting transactions that have already been
838 * confirnmed.
839 *
840 * Blocks don't typically have more than 4000 transactions, so this should
841 * be at least six blocks (~1 hr) worth of transactions that we can store,
842 * inserting both a txid and wtxid for every observed transaction.
843 * If the number of transactions appearing in a block goes up, or if we are
844 * seeing getdata requests more than an hour after initial announcement, we
845 * can increase this number.
846 * The false positive rate of 1/1M should come out to less than 1
847 * transaction per day that would be inadvertently ignored (which is the
848 * same probability that we have in the reject filter).
849 */
850 Mutex m_recent_confirmed_transactions_mutex;
851 CRollingBloomFilter m_recent_confirmed_transactions GUARDED_BY(m_recent_confirmed_transactions_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_recent_confirmed_transactions_mutex
))){48'000, 0.000'001};
852
853 /**
854 * For sending `inv`s to inbound peers, we use a single (exponentially
855 * distributed) timer for all peers. If we used a separate timer for each
856 * peer, a spy node could make multiple inbound connections to us to
857 * accurately determine when we received the transaction (and potentially
858 * determine the transaction's origin). */
859 std::chrono::microseconds NextInvToInbounds(std::chrono::microseconds now,
860 std::chrono::seconds average_interval);
861
862
863 // All of the following cache a recent block, and are protected by m_most_recent_block_mutex
864 Mutex m_most_recent_block_mutex;
865 std::shared_ptr<const CBlock> m_most_recent_block GUARDED_BY(m_most_recent_block_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_most_recent_block_mutex)));
866 std::shared_ptr<const CBlockHeaderAndShortTxIDs> m_most_recent_compact_block GUARDED_BY(m_most_recent_block_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_most_recent_block_mutex)));
867 uint256 m_most_recent_block_hash GUARDED_BY(m_most_recent_block_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_most_recent_block_mutex)));
868 std::unique_ptr<const std::map<uint256, CTransactionRef>> m_most_recent_block_txs GUARDED_BY(m_most_recent_block_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_most_recent_block_mutex)));
869
870 // Data about the low-work headers synchronization, aggregated from all peers' HeadersSyncStates.
871 /** Mutex guarding the other m_headers_presync_* variables. */
872 Mutex m_headers_presync_mutex;
873 /** A type to represent statistics about a peer's low-work headers sync.
874 *
875 * - The first field is the total verified amount of work in that synchronization.
876 * - The second is:
877 * - nullopt: the sync is in REDOWNLOAD phase (phase 2).
878 * - {height, timestamp}: the sync has the specified tip height and block timestamp (phase 1).
879 */
880 using HeadersPresyncStats = std::pair<arith_uint256, std::optional<std::pair<int64_t, uint32_t>>>;
881 /** Statistics for all peers in low-work headers sync. */
882 std::map<NodeId, HeadersPresyncStats> m_headers_presync_stats GUARDED_BY(m_headers_presync_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_headers_presync_mutex))) {};
883 /** The peer with the most-work entry in m_headers_presync_stats. */
884 NodeId m_headers_presync_bestpeer GUARDED_BY(m_headers_presync_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(m_headers_presync_mutex))) {-1};
885 /** The m_headers_presync_stats improved, and needs signalling. */
886 std::atomic_bool m_headers_presync_should_signal{false};
887
888 /** Height of the highest block announced using BIP 152 high-bandwidth mode. */
889 int m_highest_fast_announce GUARDED_BY(::cs_main)__attribute__((guarded_by(::cs_main))){0};
890
891 /** Have we requested this block from a peer */
892 bool IsBlockRequested(const uint256& hash) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main)));
893
894 /** Have we requested this block from an outbound peer */
895 bool IsBlockRequestedFromOutbound(const uint256& hash) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main)));
896
897 /** Remove this block from our tracked requested blocks. Called if:
898 * - the block has been received from a peer
899 * - the request for the block has timed out
900 * If "from_peer" is specified, then only remove the block if it is in
901 * flight from that peer (to avoid one peer's network traffic from
902 * affecting another's state).
903 */
904 void RemoveBlockRequest(const uint256& hash, std::optional<NodeId> from_peer) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main)));
905
906 /* Mark a block as in flight
907 * Returns false, still setting pit, if the block was already in flight from the same peer
908 * pit will only be valid as long as the same cs_main lock is being held
909 */
910 bool BlockRequested(NodeId nodeid, const CBlockIndex& block, std::list<QueuedBlock>::iterator** pit = nullptr) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main)));
911
912 bool TipMayBeStale() EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main)));
913
914 /** Update pindexLastCommonBlock and add not-in-flight missing successors to vBlocks, until it has
915 * at most count entries.
916 */
917 void FindNextBlocksToDownload(const Peer& peer, unsigned int count, std::vector<const CBlockIndex*>& vBlocks, NodeId& nodeStaller) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main)));
918
919 /** Request blocks for the background chainstate, if one is in use. */
920 void TryDownloadingHistoricalBlocks(const Peer& peer, unsigned int count, std::vector<const CBlockIndex*>& vBlocks, const CBlockIndex* from_tip, const CBlockIndex* target_block) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main)));
921
922 /**
923 * \brief Find next blocks to download from a peer after a starting block.
924 *
925 * \param vBlocks Vector of blocks to download which will be appended to.
926 * \param peer Peer which blocks will be downloaded from.
927 * \param state Pointer to the state of the peer.
928 * \param pindexWalk Pointer to the starting block to add to vBlocks.
929 * \param count Maximum number of blocks to allow in vBlocks. No more
930 * blocks will be added if it reaches this size.
931 * \param nWindowEnd Maximum height of blocks to allow in vBlocks. No
932 * blocks will be added above this height.
933 * \param activeChain Optional pointer to a chain to compare against. If
934 * provided, any next blocks which are already contained
935 * in this chain will not be appended to vBlocks, but
936 * instead will be used to update the
937 * state->pindexLastCommonBlock pointer.
938 * \param nodeStaller Optional pointer to a NodeId variable that will receive
939 * the ID of another peer that might be causing this peer
940 * to stall. This is set to the ID of the peer which
941 * first requested the first in-flight block in the
942 * download window. It is only set if vBlocks is empty at
943 * the end of this function call and if increasing
944 * nWindowEnd by 1 would cause it to be non-empty (which
945 * indicates the download might be stalled because every
946 * block in the window is in flight and no other peer is
947 * trying to download the next block).
948 */
949 void FindNextBlocks(std::vector<const CBlockIndex*>& vBlocks, const Peer& peer, CNodeState *state, const CBlockIndex *pindexWalk, unsigned int count, int nWindowEnd, const CChain* activeChain=nullptr, NodeId* nodeStaller=nullptr) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main)));
950
951 /* Multimap used to preserve insertion order */
952 typedef std::multimap<uint256, std::pair<NodeId, std::list<QueuedBlock>::iterator>> BlockDownloadMap;
953 BlockDownloadMap mapBlocksInFlight GUARDED_BY(cs_main)__attribute__((guarded_by(cs_main)));
954
955 /** When our tip was last updated. */
956 std::atomic<std::chrono::seconds> m_last_tip_update{0s};
957
958 /** Determine whether or not a peer can request a transaction, and return it (or nullptr if not found or not allowed). */
959 CTransactionRef FindTxForGetData(const Peer::TxRelay& tx_relay, const GenTxid& gtxid)
960 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_most_recent_block_mutex, NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_most_recent_block_mutex
, NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex)));
961
962 void ProcessGetData(CNode& pfrom, Peer& peer, const std::atomic<bool>& interruptMsgProc)
963 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_most_recent_block_mutex, peer.m_getdata_requests_mutex, NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_most_recent_block_mutex
, peer.m_getdata_requests_mutex, NetEventsInterface::g_msgproc_mutex
)))
964 LOCKS_EXCLUDED(::cs_main)__attribute__((locks_excluded(::cs_main)));
965
966 /** Process a new block. Perform any post-processing housekeeping */
967 void ProcessBlock(CNode& node, const std::shared_ptr<const CBlock>& block, bool force_processing, bool min_pow_checked);
968
969 /** Process compact block txns */
970 void ProcessCompactBlockTxns(CNode& pfrom, Peer& peer, const BlockTransactions& block_transactions)
971 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(g_msgproc_mutex, !m_most_recent_block_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(g_msgproc_mutex, !m_most_recent_block_mutex
)));
972
973 /**
974 * When a peer sends us a valid block, instruct it to announce blocks to us
975 * using CMPCTBLOCK if possible by adding its nodeid to the end of
976 * lNodesAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs, and keeping that list under a certain size by
977 * removing the first element if necessary.
978 */
979 void MaybeSetPeerAsAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs(NodeId nodeid) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main)));
980
981 /** Stack of nodes which we have set to announce using compact blocks */
982 std::list<NodeId> lNodesAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs GUARDED_BY(cs_main)__attribute__((guarded_by(cs_main)));
983
984 /** Number of peers from which we're downloading blocks. */
985 int m_peers_downloading_from GUARDED_BY(cs_main)__attribute__((guarded_by(cs_main))) = 0;
986
987 /** Storage for orphan information */
988 TxOrphanage m_orphanage;
989
990 void AddToCompactExtraTransactions(const CTransactionRef& tx) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(g_msgproc_mutex)));
991
992 /** Orphan/conflicted/etc transactions that are kept for compact block reconstruction.
993 * The last -blockreconstructionextratxn/DEFAULT_BLOCK_RECONSTRUCTION_EXTRA_TXN of
994 * these are kept in a ring buffer */
995 std::vector<std::pair<uint256, CTransactionRef>> vExtraTxnForCompact GUARDED_BY(g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(g_msgproc_mutex)));
996 /** Offset into vExtraTxnForCompact to insert the next tx */
997 size_t vExtraTxnForCompactIt GUARDED_BY(g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((guarded_by(g_msgproc_mutex))) = 0;
998
999 /** Check whether the last unknown block a peer advertised is not yet known. */
1000 void ProcessBlockAvailability(NodeId nodeid) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main)));
1001 /** Update tracking information about which blocks a peer is assumed to have. */
1002 void UpdateBlockAvailability(NodeId nodeid, const uint256& hash) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main)));
1003 bool CanDirectFetch() EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main)));
1004
1005 /**
1006 * Estimates the distance, in blocks, between the best-known block and the network chain tip.
1007 * Utilizes the best-block time and the chainparams blocks spacing to approximate it.
1008 */
1009 int64_t ApproximateBestBlockDepth() const;
1010
1011 /**
1012 * To prevent fingerprinting attacks, only send blocks/headers outside of
1013 * the active chain if they are no more than a month older (both in time,
1014 * and in best equivalent proof of work) than the best header chain we know
1015 * about and we fully-validated them at some point.
1016 */
1017 bool BlockRequestAllowed(const CBlockIndex* pindex) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main)));
1018 bool AlreadyHaveBlock(const uint256& block_hash) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main)));
1019 void ProcessGetBlockData(CNode& pfrom, Peer& peer, const CInv& inv)
1020 EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(!m_most_recent_block_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(!m_most_recent_block_mutex
)));
1021
1022 /**
1023 * Validation logic for compact filters request handling.
1024 *
1025 * May disconnect from the peer in the case of a bad request.
1026 *
1027 * @param[in] node The node that we received the request from
1028 * @param[in] peer The peer that we received the request from
1029 * @param[in] filter_type The filter type the request is for. Must be basic filters.
1030 * @param[in] start_height The start height for the request
1031 * @param[in] stop_hash The stop_hash for the request
1032 * @param[in] max_height_diff The maximum number of items permitted to request, as specified in BIP 157
1033 * @param[out] stop_index The CBlockIndex for the stop_hash block, if the request can be serviced.
1034 * @param[out] filter_index The filter index, if the request can be serviced.
1035 * @return True if the request can be serviced.
1036 */
1037 bool PrepareBlockFilterRequest(CNode& node, Peer& peer,
1038 BlockFilterType filter_type, uint32_t start_height,
1039 const uint256& stop_hash, uint32_t max_height_diff,
1040 const CBlockIndex*& stop_index,
1041 BlockFilterIndex*& filter_index);
1042
1043 /**
1044 * Handle a cfilters request.
1045 *
1046 * May disconnect from the peer in the case of a bad request.
1047 *
1048 * @param[in] node The node that we received the request from
1049 * @param[in] peer The peer that we received the request from
1050 * @param[in] vRecv The raw message received
1051 */
1052 void ProcessGetCFilters(CNode& node, Peer& peer, DataStream& vRecv);
1053
1054 /**
1055 * Handle a cfheaders request.
1056 *
1057 * May disconnect from the peer in the case of a bad request.
1058 *
1059 * @param[in] node The node that we received the request from
1060 * @param[in] peer The peer that we received the request from
1061 * @param[in] vRecv The raw message received
1062 */
1063 void ProcessGetCFHeaders(CNode& node, Peer& peer, DataStream& vRecv);
1064
1065 /**
1066 * Handle a getcfcheckpt request.
1067 *
1068 * May disconnect from the peer in the case of a bad request.
1069 *
1070 * @param[in] node The node that we received the request from
1071 * @param[in] peer The peer that we received the request from
1072 * @param[in] vRecv The raw message received
1073 */
1074 void ProcessGetCFCheckPt(CNode& node, Peer& peer, DataStream& vRecv);
1075
1076 /** Checks if address relay is permitted with peer. If needed, initializes
1077 * the m_addr_known bloom filter and sets m_addr_relay_enabled to true.
1078 *
1079 * @return True if address relay is enabled with peer
1080 * False if address relay is disallowed
1081 */
1082 bool SetupAddressRelay(const CNode& node, Peer& peer) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(g_msgproc_mutex)));
1083
1084 void AddAddressKnown(Peer& peer, const CAddress& addr) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(g_msgproc_mutex)));
1085 void PushAddress(Peer& peer, const CAddress& addr) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(g_msgproc_mutex)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(g_msgproc_mutex)));
1086};
1087
1088const CNodeState* PeerManagerImpl::State(NodeId pnode) const EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main)))
1089{
1090 std::map<NodeId, CNodeState>::const_iterator it = m_node_states.find(pnode);
1091 if (it == m_node_states.end())
1092 return nullptr;
1093 return &it->second;
1094}
1095
1096CNodeState* PeerManagerImpl::State(NodeId pnode) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main)))
1097{
1098 return const_cast<CNodeState*>(std::as_const(*this).State(pnode));
1099}
1100
1101/**
1102 * Whether the peer supports the address. For example, a peer that does not
1103 * implement BIP155 cannot receive Tor v3 addresses because it requires
1104 * ADDRv2 (BIP155) encoding.
1105 */
1106static bool IsAddrCompatible(const Peer& peer, const CAddress& addr)
1107{
1108 return peer.m_wants_addrv2 || addr.IsAddrV1Compatible();
1109}
1110
1111void PeerManagerImpl::AddAddressKnown(Peer& peer, const CAddress& addr)
1112{
1113 assert(peer.m_addr_known)(static_cast <bool> (peer.m_addr_known) ? void (0) : __assert_fail
("peer.m_addr_known", "net_processing.cpp", 1113, __extension__
__PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
1114 peer.m_addr_known->insert(addr.GetKey());
1115}
1116
1117void PeerManagerImpl::PushAddress(Peer& peer, const CAddress& addr)
1118{
1119 // Known checking here is only to save space from duplicates.
1120 // Before sending, we'll filter it again for known addresses that were
1121 // added after addresses were pushed.
1122 assert(peer.m_addr_known)(static_cast <bool> (peer.m_addr_known) ? void (0) : __assert_fail
("peer.m_addr_known", "net_processing.cpp", 1122, __extension__
__PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
1123 if (addr.IsValid() && !peer.m_addr_known->contains(addr.GetKey()) && IsAddrCompatible(peer, addr)) {
1124 if (peer.m_addrs_to_send.size() >= MAX_ADDR_TO_SEND) {
1125 peer.m_addrs_to_send[m_rng.randrange(peer.m_addrs_to_send.size())] = addr;
1126 } else {
1127 peer.m_addrs_to_send.push_back(addr);
1128 }
1129 }
1130}
1131
1132static void AddKnownTx(Peer& peer, const uint256& hash)
1133{
1134 auto tx_relay = peer.GetTxRelay();
1135 if (!tx_relay) return;
1136
1137 LOCK(tx_relay->m_tx_inventory_mutex)UniqueLock criticalblock326(MaybeCheckNotHeld(tx_relay->m_tx_inventory_mutex
), "tx_relay->m_tx_inventory_mutex", "net_processing.cpp",
1137);
1138 tx_relay->m_tx_inventory_known_filter.insert(hash);
1139}
1140
1141/** Whether this peer can serve us blocks. */
1142static bool CanServeBlocks(const Peer& peer)
1143{
1144 return peer.m_their_services & (NODE_NETWORK|NODE_NETWORK_LIMITED);
1145}
1146
1147/** Whether this peer can only serve limited recent blocks (e.g. because
1148 * it prunes old blocks) */
1149static bool IsLimitedPeer(const Peer& peer)
1150{
1151 return (!(peer.m_their_services & NODE_NETWORK) &&
1152 (peer.m_their_services & NODE_NETWORK_LIMITED));
1153}
1154
1155/** Whether this peer can serve us witness data */
1156static bool CanServeWitnesses(const Peer& peer)
1157{
1158 return peer.m_their_services & NODE_WITNESS;
1159}
1160
1161std::chrono::microseconds PeerManagerImpl::NextInvToInbounds(std::chrono::microseconds now,
1162 std::chrono::seconds average_interval)
1163{
1164 if (m_next_inv_to_inbounds.load() < now) {
1165 // If this function were called from multiple threads simultaneously
1166 // it would possible that both update the next send variable, and return a different result to their caller.
1167 // This is not possible in practice as only the net processing thread invokes this function.
1168 m_next_inv_to_inbounds = GetExponentialRand(now, average_interval);
1169 }
1170 return m_next_inv_to_inbounds;
1171}
1172
1173bool PeerManagerImpl::IsBlockRequested(const uint256& hash)
1174{
1175 return mapBlocksInFlight.count(hash);
1176}
1177
1178bool PeerManagerImpl::IsBlockRequestedFromOutbound(const uint256& hash)
1179{
1180 for (auto range = mapBlocksInFlight.equal_range(hash); range.first != range.second; range.first++) {
1181 auto [nodeid, block_it] = range.first->second;
1182 CNodeState& nodestate = *Assert(State(nodeid))inline_assertion_check<true>(State(nodeid), "net_processing.cpp"
, 1182, __func__, "State(nodeid)");
1183 if (!nodestate.m_is_inbound) return true;
1184 }
1185
1186 return false;
1187}
1188
1189void PeerManagerImpl::RemoveBlockRequest(const uint256& hash, std::optional<NodeId> from_peer)
1190{
1191 auto range = mapBlocksInFlight.equal_range(hash);
1192 if (range.first == range.second) {
1193 // Block was not requested from any peer
1194 return;
1195 }
1196
1197 // We should not have requested too many of this block
1198 Assume(mapBlocksInFlight.count(hash) <= MAX_CMPCTBLOCKS_INFLIGHT_PER_BLOCK)inline_assertion_check<false>(mapBlocksInFlight.count(hash
) <= MAX_CMPCTBLOCKS_INFLIGHT_PER_BLOCK, "net_processing.cpp"
, 1198, __func__, "mapBlocksInFlight.count(hash) <= MAX_CMPCTBLOCKS_INFLIGHT_PER_BLOCK"
);
1199
1200 while (range.first != range.second) {
1201 auto [node_id, list_it] = range.first->second;
1202
1203 if (from_peer && *from_peer != node_id) {
1204 range.first++;
1205 continue;
1206 }
1207
1208 CNodeState& state = *Assert(State(node_id))inline_assertion_check<true>(State(node_id), "net_processing.cpp"
, 1208, __func__, "State(node_id)");
1209
1210 if (state.vBlocksInFlight.begin() == list_it) {
1211 // First block on the queue was received, update the start download time for the next one
1212 state.m_downloading_since = std::max(state.m_downloading_since, GetTime<std::chrono::microseconds>());
1213 }
1214 state.vBlocksInFlight.erase(list_it);
1215
1216 if (state.vBlocksInFlight.empty()) {
1217 // Last validated block on the queue for this peer was received.
1218 m_peers_downloading_from--;
1219 }
1220 state.m_stalling_since = 0us;
1221
1222 range.first = mapBlocksInFlight.erase(range.first);
1223 }
1224}
1225
1226bool PeerManagerImpl::BlockRequested(NodeId nodeid, const CBlockIndex& block, std::list<QueuedBlock>::iterator** pit)
1227{
1228 const uint256& hash{block.GetBlockHash()};
1229
1230 CNodeState *state = State(nodeid);
1231 assert(state != nullptr)(static_cast <bool> (state != nullptr) ? void (0) : __assert_fail
("state != nullptr", "net_processing.cpp", 1231, __extension__
__PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
1232
1233 Assume(mapBlocksInFlight.count(hash) <= MAX_CMPCTBLOCKS_INFLIGHT_PER_BLOCK)inline_assertion_check<false>(mapBlocksInFlight.count(hash
) <= MAX_CMPCTBLOCKS_INFLIGHT_PER_BLOCK, "net_processing.cpp"
, 1233, __func__, "mapBlocksInFlight.count(hash) <= MAX_CMPCTBLOCKS_INFLIGHT_PER_BLOCK"
);
1234
1235 // Short-circuit most stuff in case it is from the same node
1236 for (auto range = mapBlocksInFlight.equal_range(hash); range.first != range.second; range.first++) {
1237 if (range.first->second.first == nodeid) {
1238 if (pit) {
1239 *pit = &range.first->second.second;
1240 }
1241 return false;
1242 }
1243 }
1244
1245 // Make sure it's not being fetched already from same peer.
1246 RemoveBlockRequest(hash, nodeid);
1247
1248 std::list<QueuedBlock>::iterator it = state->vBlocksInFlight.insert(state->vBlocksInFlight.end(),
1249 {&block, std::unique_ptr<PartiallyDownloadedBlock>(pit ? new PartiallyDownloadedBlock(&m_mempool) : nullptr)});
1250 if (state->vBlocksInFlight.size() == 1) {
1251 // We're starting a block download (batch) from this peer.
1252 state->m_downloading_since = GetTime<std::chrono::microseconds>();
1253 m_peers_downloading_from++;
1254 }
1255 auto itInFlight = mapBlocksInFlight.insert(std::make_pair(hash, std::make_pair(nodeid, it)));
1256 if (pit) {
1257 *pit = &itInFlight->second.second;
1258 }
1259 return true;
1260}
1261
1262void PeerManagerImpl::MaybeSetPeerAsAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs(NodeId nodeid)
1263{
1264 AssertLockHeld(cs_main)AssertLockHeldInternal("cs_main", "net_processing.cpp", 1264,
&cs_main);
1265
1266 // When in -blocksonly mode, never request high-bandwidth mode from peers. Our
1267 // mempool will not contain the transactions necessary to reconstruct the
1268 // compact block.
1269 if (m_opts.ignore_incoming_txs) return;
6
←
Assuming field 'ignore_incoming_txs' is false
→
7
←
Taking false branch
→
1270
1271 CNodeState* nodestate = State(nodeid);
1272 if (!nodestate || !nodestate->m_provides_cmpctblocks) {
8
←
Assuming 'nodestate' is non-null
→
9
←
Assuming field 'm_provides_cmpctblocks' is true
→
10
←
Taking false branch
→
1273 // Don't request compact blocks if the peer has not signalled support
1274 return;
1275 }
1276
1277 int num_outbound_hb_peers = 0;
1278 for (std::list<NodeId>::iterator it = lNodesAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs.begin(); it != lNodesAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs.end(); it++) {
11
←
Loop condition is true. Entering loop body
→
17
←
Loop condition is false. Execution continues on line 1287
→
1279 if (*it == nodeid) {
12
←
Assuming the condition is false
→
13
←
Taking false branch
→
1280 lNodesAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs.erase(it);
1281 lNodesAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs.push_back(nodeid);
1282 return;
1283 }
1284 CNodeState *state = State(*it);
1285 if (state != nullptr && !state->m_is_inbound) ++num_outbound_hb_peers;
14
←
Assuming the condition is true
→
15
←
Assuming field 'm_is_inbound' is false
→
16
←
Taking true branch
→
1286 }
1287 if (nodestate->m_is_inbound) {
18
←
Assuming field 'm_is_inbound' is true
→
1288 // If we're adding an inbound HB peer, make sure we're not removing
1289 // our last outbound HB peer in the process.
1290 if (lNodesAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs.size() >= 3 && num_outbound_hb_peers
19.1
'num_outbound_hb_peers' is equal to 1
 == 1) {
19
←
Assuming the condition is true
→
20
←
Taking true branch
→
1291 CNodeState *remove_node = State(lNodesAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs.front());
1292 if (remove_node != nullptr && !remove_node->m_is_inbound) {
21
←
Assuming the condition is true
→
22
←
Assuming field 'm_is_inbound' is false
→
23
←
Taking true branch
→
1293 // Put the HB outbound peer in the second slot, so that it
1294 // doesn't get removed.
1295 std::swap(lNodesAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs.front(), *std::next(lNodesAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs.begin()));
24
←
Past-the-end iterator dereferenced
1296 }
1297 }
1298 }
1299 m_connman.ForNode(nodeid, [this](CNode* pfrom) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(::cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(::cs_main))) {
1300 AssertLockHeld(::cs_main)AssertLockHeldInternal("::cs_main", "net_processing.cpp", 1300
, &::cs_main);
1301 if (lNodesAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs.size() >= 3) {
1302 // As per BIP152, we only get 3 of our peers to announce
1303 // blocks using compact encodings.
1304 m_connman.ForNode(lNodesAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs.front(), [this](CNode* pnodeStop){
1305 MakeAndPushMessage(*pnodeStop, NetMsgType::SENDCMPCT, /*high_bandwidth=*/false, /*version=*/CMPCTBLOCKS_VERSION);
1306 // save BIP152 bandwidth state: we select peer to be low-bandwidth
1307 pnodeStop->m_bip152_highbandwidth_to = false;
1308 return true;
1309 });
1310 lNodesAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs.pop_front();
1311 }
1312 MakeAndPushMessage(*pfrom, NetMsgType::SENDCMPCT, /*high_bandwidth=*/true, /*version=*/CMPCTBLOCKS_VERSION);
1313 // save BIP152 bandwidth state: we select peer to be high-bandwidth
1314 pfrom->m_bip152_highbandwidth_to = true;
1315 lNodesAnnouncingHeaderAndIDs.push_back(pfrom->GetId());
1316 return true;
1317 });
1318}
1319
1320bool PeerManagerImpl::TipMayBeStale()
1321{
1322 AssertLockHeld(cs_main)AssertLockHeldInternal("cs_main", "net_processing.cpp", 1322,
&cs_main);
1323 const Consensus::Params& consensusParams = m_chainparams.GetConsensus();
1324 if (m_last_tip_update.load() == 0s) {
1325 m_last_tip_update = GetTime<std::chrono::seconds>();
1326 }
1327 return m_last_tip_update.load() < GetTime<std::chrono::seconds>() - std::chrono::seconds{consensusParams.nPowTargetSpacing * 3} && mapBlocksInFlight.empty();
1328}
1329
1330int64_t PeerManagerImpl::ApproximateBestBlockDepth() const
1331{
1332 return (GetTime<std::chrono::seconds>() - m_best_block_time.load()).count() / m_chainparams.GetConsensus().nPowTargetSpacing;
1333}
1334
1335bool PeerManagerImpl::CanDirectFetch()
1336{
1337 return m_chainman.ActiveChain().Tip()->Time() > NodeClock::now() - m_chainparams.GetConsensus().PowTargetSpacing() * 20;
1338}
1339
1340static bool PeerHasHeader(CNodeState *state, const CBlockIndex *pindex) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)__attribute__((exclusive_locks_required(cs_main)))
1341{
1342 if (state->pindexBestKnownBlock && pindex == state->pindexBestKnownBlock->GetAncestor(pindex->nHeight))
1343 return true;
1344 if (state->pindexBestHeaderSent && pindex == state->pindexBestHeaderSent->GetAncestor(pindex->nHeight))
1345 return true;
1346 return false;
1347}
1348
1349void PeerManagerImpl::ProcessBlockAvailability(NodeId nodeid) {
1350 CNodeState *state = State(nodeid);
1351 assert(state != nullptr)(static_cast <bool> (state != nullptr) ? void (0) : __assert_fail
("state != nullptr", "net_processing.cpp", 1351, __extension__
__PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
1352
1353 if (!state->hashLastUnknownBlock.IsNull()) {
1354 const CBlockIndex* pindex = m_chainman.m_blockman.LookupBlockIndex(state->hashLastUnknownBlock);
1355 if (pindex && pindex->nChainWork > 0) {
1356 if (state->pindexBestKnownBlock == nullptr || pindex->nChainWork >= state->pindexBestKnownBlock->nChainWork) {
1357 state->pindexBestKnownBlock = pindex;
1358 }
1359 state->hashLastUnknownBlock.SetNull();
1360 }
1361 }
1362}
1363
1364void PeerManagerImpl::UpdateBlockAvailability(NodeId nodeid, const uint256 &hash) {
1365 CNodeState *state = State(nodeid);
1366 assert(state != nullptr)(static_cast <bool> (state != nullptr) ? void (0) : __assert_fail
("state != nullptr", "net_processing.cpp", 1366, __extension__
__PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
1367
1368 ProcessBlockAvailability(nodeid);
1369
1370 const CBlockIndex* pindex = m_chainman.m_blockman.LookupBlockIndex(hash);
1371 if (pindex && pindex->nChainWork > 0) {
1372 // An actually better block was announced.
1373 if (state->pindexBestKnownBlock == nullptr || pindex->nChainWork >= state->pindexBestKnownBlock->nChainWork) {
1374 state->pindexBestKnownBlock = pindex;
1375 }
1376 } else {
1377 // An unknown block was announced; just assume that the latest one is the best one.
1378 state->hashLastUnknownBlock = hash;
1379 }
1380}
1381
1382// Logic for calculating which blocks to download from a given peer, given our current tip.
1383void PeerManagerImpl::FindNextBlocksToDownload(const Peer& peer, unsigned int count, std::vector<const CBlockIndex*>& vBlocks, NodeId& nodeStaller)
1384{
1385 if (count == 0)
1386 return;
1387
1388 vBlocks.reserve(vBlocks.size() + count);
1389 CNodeState *state = State(peer.m_id);
1390 assert(state != nullptr)(static_cast <bool> (state != nullptr) ? void (0) : __assert_fail
("state != nullptr", "net_processing.cpp", 1390, __extension__
__PRETTY_FUNCTION__));
1391
1392 // Make sure pindexBestKnownBlock is up to date, we'll need it.
1393 ProcessBlockAvailability(peer.m_id);
1394
1395 if (state->pindexBestKnownBlock == nullptr || state->pindexBestKnownBlock->nChainWork < m_chainman.ActiveChain().Tip()->nChainWork || state->pindexBestKnownBlock->nChainWork < m_chainman.MinimumChainWork()) {
1396 // This peer has nothing interesting.
1397 return;
1398 }
1399
